page.title: 11TROON Cornwall - Climate
page.content: The climate of the area is very much dominated by Copper Hill and the high ground to the south east. The prevailing wind is from the south west, and TROON and its surrounding area often suffers from being on the weather side of the hill. Four Lanes, just to the south east of the area, is often shrouded in mist and low cloud for days at a time. However the high ground does help to protect the area from cold easterly winds, and hard frosts are virtually unknown. In fact most of Cornwall has very mild weather, being surrounded on three sides by sea.
